name: Vim
title: A useful collection of [Vim](http://www.vim.org/) 8.2 quick reference cheat sheets to help you learn vim editor faster.

cards.title: Intro
cards.body: A useful collection of [Vim](http://www.vim.org/) 8.2 quick reference cheat sheets to help you learn vim editor faster.

cards.title: Motion Diagrams
cards.code:
- SCREEN 1 START
   ┌─┬─────────▷ #!/usr/bin/python
   │ │     ┌───▷
   │ │     │     print("Hello")
   │ │     { } ▶ print("Vim")
   │ │       │   print("!")
   │ │       └─▷
   │ │ ┌───┬───▷ print("Welcome")
G gg H M L k j ▶ print("to")
│        │   └─▷ print("cheatsheets.zip")
│        │       print("/vim")
│        │
│        └─────▷
│                - SCREEN 1 END
└──────────────▷ print("SCREEN 2")

cards.title: Macros
cards.body: You can save macro for any letters not just `i`

cards.title: Usage
cards.body: Operate with an [operator](#available-operators) inner or around text blocks

cards.title: Buffers
cards.back: Edit a file in a new buffer

cards.title: Buffers
cards.back: Go to a buffer by file

cards.title: Buffers
cards.back: Write file and move to next

cards.title: Windows
cards.back: Break out into a new tab

cards.title: Tabs
cards.back: Open if exists in new tab

cards.title: Examples
cards.body:
```c {.wrap}
:s/a\|b/xxx\0xxx/g		         # Modifies "a b"      to "xxxaxxx xxxbxxx"
:s/test/\U& file/                # Modifies "test"     to "TEST FILE"
:s/\(test\)/\U\1\e file/         # Modifies "test"     to "TEST file"
:s/\v([abc])([efg])/\2\1/g	     # Modifies "af fa bg" to "fa fa gb"
:s/\v\w+/\u\0/g		             # Modifies "bla bla"  to "Bla Bla"
:s/\v([ab])|([cd])/\1x/g         # Modifies "a b c d"  to "ax bx x x"
:%s/.*/\L&/                      # Modifies "HTML"     to "html"
:s/\v<(.)(\w*)/\u\1\L\2/g        # Make every first letter of a word uppercase
:%s/^\(.*\)\n\1/\1/              # Remove duplicate lines
:%s/<\/\=\(\w\+\)\>/\U&/g        # Convert HTML-Tags to uppercase
:g/^pattern/s/$/mytext           # Find and append text to the end
:g/pattern/norm! @i              # Run a macro on matching lines
/^\(.*\)\(\r\?\n\1\)\+$          # View the duplicates lines
/\v^(.*)(\r?\n\1)+$              # View the duplicates lines (very magic)
:v/./,/./-j                      # Compress blank lines into a blank line
:g/<p1>/,/<p2>/d                 # Delete inclusively from <p1> to <p2>

cards.title: Examples
cards.code:
## Vimdiff

### Usage {.secondary}

```shell script

$ vimdiff file1 file2 [file3]
$ vim -d file1 file2 [file3]

cards.title: Usage
cards.body: The Quickfix List is primarily used to navigate a list of errors/warnings (or file locations) generated by a compiler or linter.

cards.title: Usage
cards.back: Go to the **next** error/location (`:cn` also works)

cards.title: Usage
cards.back: Go to the **previous** error/location (`:cp` also works)

cards.title: Usage
cards.back: List all errors/locations in the list

cards.title: Usage
cards.back: Populate the list with errors from a file (e.g., a compiler log)

cards.title: Quickfix Do (`:cdo` and `:cfdo`)
cards.body: The `:cdo` (quickfix do) and `:cfdo` (quickfix file do) commands execute a command in every file listed in the quickfix list. `:cdo` iterates over every _location_ in the list, while `:cfdo` iterates over every _unique file_ in the list.

cards.title: Quickfix Do (`:cdo` and `:cfdo`)
cards.back: Execute `[cmd]` for every **location** in the quickfix list.

cards.title: Quickfix Do (`:cdo` and `:cfdo`)
cards.back: Execute `[cmd]` for every **unique file** in the quickfix list.

cards.title: Tags
cards.back: Jump to first definition of Classname

cards.title: Marks

```shell script

cards.title: Tricks
cards.body:
```shell script
:%w !pbcopy            # Mac OS X
:%w !xclip -i -sel c   # GNU/Linux
:%w !xsel -i -b        # GNU/Linux
